acronyms.title: Acronyms
acronyms.description: A quick guide to most  respirator-related acronyms.

all-about-respirators.title: All About Respirators
all-about-respirators.description: Read pages below to learn more about respirator types and use.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: This mobile app aims to make the process of choosing the correct respirator easier and faster. It is based on the NIOSH Respirator Selection Logic (RSL). Like a logic flow diagram, or a “wizard,” each question helps to narrow down the available options.

osha-standards.title: OSHA Standards
osha-standards.description: The OSHA standards that follow may be found under 29 CFR 1910 Subpart I– Personal Protective Equipment. Respiratory protection falls under 1910.134. These standards apply to General Industry (part 1910), Shipyards (part 1915), Marine Terminals (part 1917), Longshoring (part 1918), and Construction (part 1926). Paragraphs (d)(3)(i)(A) and (d)(3)(i)(B) of this section became effective November 22, 2006. Compliance with Appendix A, Appendix B-1, Appendix B-2, Appendix C, and Appendix D to this section are mandatory.
